subject: Re: [junit] OT: Bad examples everywhere  (Was: distinguishing	between failures and errors)
msgSnippet: [snip...] I ve fallen in love with Log4J.  Doing something like: catch (Exception ex) { log.error( Something bad happened here , ex) } is just a nice thing to
messageBody:
[snip...]
I've fallen in love with
Log4J. Doing something like:

catch (Exception ex) {
log.error("Something bad happened here", ex)
}

is just a nice thing to have. Your own error message
AND the exception message AND the stack trace.
[end snip...]

... which is just as easy to get by having the following in some utility
class:

StringWriter sw = new StringWriter();
PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(sw);
ex.printStackTrace(pw);
return <your own message prepended to> + sw.toString();

=jason
